intro: Chalybea corymbifera, commonly known as the silver vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other ornamental and medicinal plants. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Chalybea corymbifera is also popular as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
